intro: Ardisia foveolata, commonly known as the clustered beautyberry, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas, including parts of Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters, followed by bright red berries that are a striking feature of the plant. Its leaves are evergreen, glossy, and elliptical in shape, contributing to its ornamental value. Ardisia foveolata is often cultivated in gardens for its aesthetic appeal and ability to thrive in partial shade.
